title: 3-Step Cantonese Roast Duck Soup Noodles
full_text:
3-Step Cantonese Roast Duck Soup Noodles

4 servings

Ingredients
12
ounces
Chinese wheat
or
egg noodles
, or
vermicelli
or thin
spaghetti
4
cups

chicken broth
4
cups
water
2
teaspoons
Chinese rice wine
or dry sherry
3
slices
unpeeled
fresh ginger
8
ounces
yu choy
, cut into 2-inch pieces, or other fresh greens such as spinach, watercress, Napa cabbage, etc.

Chinese roast duck

Directions
In a large pot of boiling water, cook the dried noodles until a little softer than al dente, about 3 minutes, or 2 minutes if the noodles are fresh. Drain, rinse in cold water, and set aside to drain again.
Pour broth and water into a saucepan and add the wine and ginger. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the greens and cook until they are just wilted and tender; do not overcook. Add the duck—about 3 to 5 pieces per person—and 2 or 3 tablespoons of the sauce that the shops pack with the duck. Cook until the broth just returns to a boil. Remove from the heat and add salt to taste.
Rinse the cooked noodles with a kettle of boiling water to warm and loosen. Drain thoroughly, and divide the noodles evenly between four large noodle bowls. Top each bowl with some of the greens, pieces of duck, and a teaspoonful of the scallion. Remove and discard the ginger from the broth, if desired. Ladle the hot broth over the toppings and noodles and serve immediately.
Notes
Don't let the noodles sit too long in the hot broth because they will absorb the liquid and lose their chewy texture.
